newsitem.title: UK: Euro oil products steady, though fuel barges softe.
newsitem.headline: Euro oil products steady, though fuel barges softe.

text.p: NWE oil products were steady on Tuesday, traders said, although fuel oil slipped in value.

Gas oil prices were steady with stable barge and cargo premiums countering slightly softer benchmark gas oil futures. Barge offers were around June IPE +$2/+$2.50 fob Rotterdam. Bids were notionally pegged around screen flat to June +$1 a tonne.
Gasoline was firm on NYMEX unleaded gains. Eurograde barges traded between $201 and $202.50. Naphtha was extremely weak in the near-term, but traders were looking for better June demand.
High sulphur barges lost $1 to trade at $84/$85 amid scepticism over the durability of crude's rise.
Cargoes were quiet, with few trading while refinery margins are so bad.
